content.description: Fun problem with a scary landing. Start on obvious mega jug low and left. Work up through shelf jugs on the left of the large crack. The crux is the final hold which is a large left-handed crimp. Lock-off the crimp and pull to crystal jug finish with an easy top out.
content.protection: You will need a good few pads or a really good spotter. The fall isn't big but the landing is uneven. Do not climb alone unless it is way below your capabilities.
content.location: This problem is located on the twilight warm-up boulder. This boulder is the first you will see and the closest from the parking. If standing at the parking area the problem will be on the far right on the opposite side of the boulder. If facing the boulder on the other side the problem will be low and left.

content.description: Start low on huge crack, following it all the way to the top out. Top out is crux.
content.location: This boulder is on the opposite side of the closest boulder to the parking. It is in between that boulder and the giant outcropping.

content.description: Start low on a long rail with a heel hook. The first move is out to an obvious bulge on the arete. Either meat wrap up the arete or use left hand on crystal crimps to move. Finishes at the same spot as Twilight Crack.
content.location: This boulder is the closest to the parking area and the climb will start on the leftmost side if standing at the parking area. If standing at Twilight Crack will be on the far right.

content.description: This is a dyno that starts on the first of the two large shark tooth shaped outcroppings. High foot on the feature to the right with a small left foot in the middle of the face. Throw for second shark tooth while avoiding the small tree to the left of the finish jug. Can be either a two or one hand throw. If your reach is above 6ft you most likely will be able to keep the start hand.
content.protection: The landing is very flat with one tree near the landing zone but not too close for comfort. Two pads will be plenty.
content.location: After leaving the parking area head to the left about 200ft until you come to a boulder with two shark tooth looking outcroppings. The upper tooth will be right beside a small tree that is growing around it. This boulder is fairly obvious and should take no more than a minute to walk to from the parking lot.

content.description: Start at the very bottom of the right arete on soft right-hand crimp and left and on protruding jug. Work up the arete until topping out at the highest point of the boulder. Be ready to engage that heel hook!
content.protection: Bring a few pads unless you plan to drag one quite a ways.
content.location: After parking, stay right of the largest outcropping of rock. Pass this and on the left will be Honeycomb Moray with a tree beside it near the middle of the route, towards the top out.

content.description: Start sitting with medium-sized crimp about two feet right of the crack. Climb straight up through small pebbles until reaching a sideways jug near the top. Top out on fairly good slopey jugs.
content.location: After parking, stay left of the boulders until coming to a flat wall littered with pebbles. Fairly obvious.

content.description: Secluded, not a lot of traffic for climbing. Surrounds areas are great for mountain biking. Main rock cluster as few climbs about V0-1. Some of the higher rocks could be Top roped and are roughly 5.7-9 in difficulty. Other boulders are within walking distance of the parking area using some accessible by trails. Rock type and quality is varied. Includes conglomerate rock with some crystals interspersed.
